import { Modal } from 'fannypack/Modal/Modal';
import Theme from '../../components/Theme';

# Modal

## Import

```jsx
import { Modal } from 'fannypack';
```

## Usage

```function-live
function Example() {
  const modal = Modal.useState()

  return (
    <div>
      <Modal.Disclosure {...modal}>Toggle</Modal.Disclosure>
      <Modal {...modal}>Hello world</Modal>
    </div>
  )
}
```

## Props

### Modal.useState Props

<!-- Automatically generated -->

**<Code marginRight="major-1">visible</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

Whether it's visible or not.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_animated</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">number | boolean</Code> 

If `true`, `animating` will be set to `true` when `visible` changes.
It'll wait for `stopAnimation` to be called or a CSS transition ends.
If it's a number, `stopAnimation` will be called automatically after
given milliseconds.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

### Modal.useState Return Values

<!-- Automatically generated -->

<details><Box use="summary" marginBottom="major-2"><strong>6 values</strong></Box>

**<Code marginRight="major-1">visible</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> <Text marginLeft="major-1" fontSize="150" textTransform="uppercase" color="gray">Required</Text>

Whether it's visible or not.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_animated</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">number | boolean</Code> <Text marginLeft="major-1" fontSize="150" textTransform="uppercase" color="gray">Required</Text>

If `true`, `animating` will be set to `true` when `visible` changes.
It'll wait for `stopAnimation` to be called or a CSS transition ends.
If it's a number, `stopAnimation` will be called automatically after
given milliseconds.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">show</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">() =&#62; void</Code> <Text marginLeft="major-1" fontSize="150" textTransform="uppercase" color="gray">Required</Text>

Changes the `visible` state to `true`

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">hide</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">() =&#62; void</Code> <Text marginLeft="major-1" fontSize="150" textTransform="uppercase" color="gray">Required</Text>

Changes the `visible` state to `false`

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">toggle</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">() =&#62; void</Code> <Text marginLeft="major-1" fontSize="150" textTransform="uppercase" color="gray">Required</Text>

Toggles the `visible` state

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_stopAnimation</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">() =&#62; void</Code> <Text marginLeft="major-1" fontSize="150" textTransform="uppercase" color="gray">Required</Text>

Stops animation. It's called automatically if there's a CSS transition.
It's called after given milliseconds if `animated` is a number.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

</details>
    

### Modal Props

<!-- Automatically generated -->

**<Code marginRight="major-1">modal</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

Toggles Dialog's `modal` state.

  - Non-modal: `preventBodyScroll` doesn't work and focus is free.
  - Modal: `preventBodyScroll` is automatically enabled, focus is
trapped within the dialog and the dialog is rendered within a `Portal`
by default.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">hideOnEsc</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

When enabled, user can hide the dialog by pressing `Escape`.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">hideOnClickOutside</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

When enabled, user can hide the dialog by clicking outside it.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">preventBodyScroll</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

When enabled, user can't scroll on body when the dialog is visible.
This option doesn't work if the dialog isn't modal.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_initialFocusRef</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">RefObject&#60;HTMLElement&#62;</Code> 

The element that will be focused when the dialog shows.
When not set, the first tabbable element within the dialog will be used.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_finalFocusRef</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">RefObject&#60;HTMLElement&#62;</Code> 

The element that will be focused when the dialog hides.
When not set, the disclosure component will be used.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_portal</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

Whether or not the dialog should be rendered within `Portal`.
It's `true` by default if `modal` is `true`.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_orphan</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

Whether or not the dialog should be a child of its parent.
Opening a nested orphan dialog will close its parent dialog if
`hideOnClickOutside` is set to `true` on the parent.
It will be set to `false` if `modal` is `false`.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

<details><Box use="summary" marginBottom="major-2"><strong>4 state props</strong></Box>
<blockquote>These props are returned by the state hook. You can spread them into this component (<code>...state</code>) or pass them separately. You can also provide these props from your own state logic.</blockquote>

**<Code marginRight="major-1">visible</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

Whether it's visible or not.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_animated</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">number | boolean</Code> 

If `true`, `animating` will be set to `true` when `visible` changes.
It'll wait for `stopAnimation` to be called or a CSS transition ends.
If it's a number, `stopAnimation` will be called automatically after
given milliseconds.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">unstable_stopAnimation</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">() =&#62; void</Code> 

Stops animation. It's called automatically if there's a CSS transition.
It's called after given milliseconds if `animated` is a number.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">hide</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">() =&#62; void</Code> 

Changes the `visible` state to `false`

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

</details>

### Modal.Disclosure Props

<!-- Automatically generated -->

**<Code marginRight="major-1">disabled</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

Same as the HTML attribute.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

**<Code marginRight="major-1">focusable</Code>** <Code fontSize="150" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

When an element is `disabled`, it may still be `focusable`. It works
similarly to `readOnly` on form elements. In this case, only
`aria-disabled` will be set.

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

<Box marginBottom="major-4" />

</details>

## Theming

<Theme component={Modal} overrides={[{ key: 'Modal.base' }]}>
  Hello world
</Theme>
